channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: This Soccer Player Wanted to Wear Her Hijab on the Field. France Wouldn’t Let Her.
item.description: Lina Boussaha joined a team in Saudi Arabia so she could wear her head scarf while playing the sport she calls “a part of my soul.”

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Gaza City Neighborhood Left in Ruins After Israeli Withdrawal
item.description: Residents and rescue workers say they found dozens of bodies and most of the buildings destroyed in the Shajaiye neighborhood after Israeli forces ended a two-week offensive against Hamas fighters.

item.title: In a striking reversal, Tesla CEO Elon Musk donates to Trump’s reelection bid
item.description: Musk has yet to publicly endorse a candidate in the 2024 race.

item.title: Where Germany’s Immigration Debate Hits Home
item.description: Since the recent killing of a police officer, Mannheim has become the byword for a hard line on deporting those who are denied asylum and commit violent crime.

item.title: This Soccer Player Wanted to Wear Her Hijab on the Field. France Wouldn’t Let Her.
item.description: Lina Boussaha joined a team in Saudi Arabia so she could wear her head scarf while playing the sport she calls “a part of my soul.”

item.title: Stunning tourist paradise marred by fatal plane crashes
item.description: The latest helicopter crash in Kauai came after a series of deadly accidents last year.

item.title: Judge Dismisses Alec Baldwin Case in ‘Rust’ Shooting: What to Know
item.description: The actor was accused of involuntary manslaughter in the fatal shooting of the cinematographer on the film “Rust.” The judge dismissed the case after ruling that the state had withheld evidence.

item.title: Where Germany’s Immigration Debate Hits Home
item.description: Since the recent killing of a police officer, Mannheim has become the byword for a hard line on deporting those who are denied asylum and commit violent crime.

item.title: Bank profits slide as people struggle with debt
item.description: JPMorgan set aside $3.1 billion to cover potentially bad loans, up sharply from a year earlier, as delinquencies climb among some Americans.

item.title: Judge Dismisses Giuliani’s Bankruptcy Case
item.description: The decision means that the former New York City mayor and lawyer for Donald Trump will face his creditors without protection from federal bankruptcy laws.

item.title: Pakistan Court Grants Imran Khan’s Party More Seats in Parliament
item.description: A ruling by Pakistan’s top court strips the governing coalition of its two-thirds majority, and thrusts the party of Imran Khan back onto the political main stage.

item.title: The world’s top crude exporter has quadrupled imports of fuel oil to the highest level in more than 3 years
item.description: Shipments of fuel oil rose in June to the most since at least the end of 2020, and are expected to remain elevated this month.

item.title: Kennedy Sent Apologetic Text to Woman Who Accused Him of Sexual Assault
item.description: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. privately reached out last week to a woman who accused him of sexually assaulting her in the late 1990s, an account detailed in a recent magazine article.

item.title: Gaza City Neighborhood Left in Ruins After Israeli Troops Withdraw
item.description: Intense fighting between soldiers and Hamas militants has left parts of the city uninhabitable, say residents who returned.

item.title: The world’s top HR association cuts ‘equity’ from its diversity program amid DEI backlash
item.description: The Society for Human Resources Management said it will be adopting the acronym “I&D” — or inclusion and diversity — and removing the “E” from its previous “IE&D” strategy.
